subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A vapour barrier must be installed under slab-on-ground construction for a Class 1 building and for a Class 10 building where the slab is continuous with the slab of a Class 1 building in accordance with (2), (3), (4) and (5).

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Materials: A vapour barrier must be—

ol.li: 0.2 mm nominal thickness polyethylene film; and

subclause.p: determined in accordance with criteria specified in clause 5.3.3.3 of AS 2870.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: A vapour barrier must be branded continuously “AS 2870 Concrete underlay, 0.2 mm Medium impact resistance”.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Installation: A vapour barrier must be installed as follows:

ol.li: Lap not less than 200 mm at all joints.
Tape or seal with a close-fitting sleeve around all service penetrations.
Fully seal where punctured (unless for service penetrations) with additional polyethylene film and tape.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: The vapour barrier must be placed beneath the slab so that the bottom surface of the slab is entirely underlaid and must extend under internal and edge beams to finish at ground level in accordance with Figure 4.2.8.

image-reference.title: Acceptable vapour barrier and damp-proofing membrane location
